title.rendered: Organic Fertilizer Sales in North America to Soar at 8.2% CAGR through 2034 Amid Growing Organic Food Demand and Adoption of Sustainable Farming Practices

content.rendered:
The North America organic fertilizers market is expected to show impressive growth in the future, opines Future Market Insights (FMI) in its latest study. The market is expected to top a valuation of USD 4,415.8 million by 2034. The increasing adoption of organic farming methods in the United States. and Canada are giving impetus to the sales of organic fertilizers.

NEWARK, Del, Aug. 05, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — As per the latest analysis, the North America organic fertilizer industry is estimated to be valued at USD 1,999.4 million in 2024 and USD 4,415.8 million by 2034. Overall demand for organic fertilizers across North America is projected to increase at a CAGR of 8.2%.

Sales of liquid organic fertilizers are predicted to outpace those of dry ones. This is attributable to the growing end-user preference for liquid fertilizers due to their advantages like convenience and versatility. The target segment is set to expand at 9.5% CAGR through 2034.

Pesticides, synthetic growth regulators, and chemical additives are not found in organic fertilizers. The use of organic fertilizers protects consumer health by minimizing the risk of chemical residues in crops. As well as being safer for farmers and workers, organic farming reduces their exposure to harmful chemicals.

The use of organic fertilizers in agriculture contributes to a better management of water resources. They help reduce water runoff and increase water infiltration by improving soil structure and water-holding capacity. Water conservation is improved, irrigation is reduced, and drought resistance is improved.

Several factors are expected to spur the growth of the organic fertilizer industry in North America during the assessment period. These include:

  • Escalating demand for organic food products
  • Rising adoption of sustainable agricultural practices
  • Increasing government efforts to promote production and usage of bio-based fertilizers
  • Growing adoption of organic fertilizers in gardening applications
  • Rising awareness about the benefits of organic fertilizers over synthetic ones

Request Your Sample and Stay Ahead with Our Insightful Report! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/reports/sample/rep-gb-13952

Organic fertilizers are increasingly used in farming to boost soil fertility and nurture plant growth. They come from various sources, including plants, animals, minerals, and microorganisms, making them popular among eco-conscious farmers.

Organic fertilizers promote eco-friendly farming, thereby helping to meet the growing demand for organic produce. Rising awareness of healthy eating, regulations favoring organic farming, and innovations in nutrient delivery are key factors expected to foster sales growth.

More and more farmers across North America are adopting sustainable agricultural practices, including the usage of organic fertilizers. This will likely propel growth of the North America organic fertilizer industry through 2034.

Increasing awareness among farmers and consumers about the environmental impact of conventional agriculture is prompting them to adopt organic fertilizers. With a rising emphasis on sustainable and eco-friendly agricultural solutions, organic fertilizers offer a compelling opportunity.

The eco-conscious consumer base in North America is expected to propel sales growth. Similarly, the growing popularity of seaweed-based fertilizers in home gardening will likely contribute to the industry’s expansion.

Key Takeaways from the Report

  • The organic fertilizer industry revenue in North America is set to reach US$ 4,415.8 million by 2034.
  • Based on form, the liquid fertilizer segment is expected to expand at a CAGR of 9.5% through 2034.
  • By application, the gardening segment will likely expand at 9.3% CAGR from 2024 to 2034.
  • The United States is anticipated to register a CAGR of 7.0% through 2034.
  • Demand in Canada is poised to rise at a robust CAGR of 9.8% between 2024 and 2034.

What are the Key Opportunities for North America Organic Fertilizers Manufacturers?

Awareness of Biodegradable Fertilizers is Likely to Drive Demand

The food and beverage industry in the United States and Canada is expected to grow at a significant rate during the forecast period. Organic fertilizer are increasingly used in the sector for the cultivation of fruits & vegetables and cereals & crops among others. Organic fertilizer has been approved as a non-toxic additive and ingredient by several regional administrations.

Moreover, these fertilizers can be considered as best alternative to harmful agrochemicals which are extensively used for food protection. Sometimes organic fertilizers are used as non-biodegradable and non-renewable polymers used for coating some foods including fruits and vegetables.

“The North America organic fertilizer industry is anticipated to expand 2.2X through 2034. This is due to the growing adoption of precision farming techniques and the rising need for safe & eco-friendly fertilizers,”– says Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.)

Competitive Landscape

The North America organic fertilizer industry is fragmented, with top players accounting for around 20% to 25% share. Yara International ASA, The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company, Fertoz Limited, Tessenderlo Group, Sigma AgriScience, LLC, Verdesian Life Sciences LLC, Bio Green Fertilization Redefined, American Plant Food Corporation, True Organic Products Inc., Sustane Natural Fertilizer Inc., Purely Organics LLC, California Organic Fertilizers Inc., Nurture Growth Bio-Fertilizer Inc., GreenTechnologies, LLC, EnviroKure, Inc., The Fairfax Companies LLC, Quasar Energy Group, Wilbur-Ellis Holdings, Inc., Den Ouden Groep, and Central Iowa Organic Fertilizer are the leading organic fertilizer manufacturers listed in the report.

Key organic fertilizer companies are constantly investing in research and development to introduce new biofertilizers to meet growing end-user demand. They are also inclined toward adopting strategies like partnerships, facility expansions, mergers, distribution agreements, and acquisitions to gain a competitive edge in the industry.

Recent Developments:

  • In 2023, Yara acquired Agribios Italiana’s organic-based fertilizer business, marking a strategic move to enhance its organic offerings in Europe and other regions.
  • In February 2020, Wilbur-Ellis introduced a new adjuvant (EFFICAX) that helps farmers optimize soil-applied residual herbicides.

Reach out to Sales to Secure Your Copy of the Report Now! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/checkout/13952

More Insights into the Report

In its latest report, Future Market Insights (FMI) offers an unbiased analysis of the North America organic fertilizer industry, providing historical data from 2019 to 2023 and forecast statistics for the period 2024 to 2034. To understand the industry potential, growth, and scope, the report is segmented based on crop type, source, form, nutrient content, application, and region.

North America Organic Fertilizer Industry Segmentation

By Source:

  • Plant-based
    • Molasses
    • Seaweed
    • Soybean Meal
    • Legume Cover Meal
    • Cottonseed Meal
    • Corn Gluten Meal
    • Green Manure
    • Others
  • Animal-based
    • Fish Emulsion
    • Bone Meal & Blood Meal
    • Urea
    • Manure
    • Milk
    • Others
  • Mineral
  • Microorganism
  • Others

By Crop Type:

  • Cereals & Grains
  • Oilseed & Pulses
  • Fruits & Vegetables
  • Others

By Form:

  • Dry Fertilizer
  • Liquid Fertilizer

By Nutrient Content:

  • Up to 20%
  • 20% to 40%
  • 40% to 60%
  • Above 60%

By Application:

By Region:

  • United States
    • Northeast
    • Southeast
    • Southwest
    • Midwest
    • West
  • Canada
    • The Atlantic Provinces
    • Central Canada
    • The Prairie Provinces
    • The West Coast
    • The Northern Territories
  • Mexico
    • Baja California
    • Northern Mexico
    • Central Mexico
    • Gulf Coast

Author by:

Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.) has over a decade of experience in market research and business consulting. He has successfully delivered 1500+ client assignments, predominantly in Automotive, Chemicals, Industrial Equipment, Oil & Gas, and Service industries.

His core competency circles around developing research methodology, creating a unique analysis framework, statistical data models for pricing analysis, competition mapping, and market feasibility analysis. His expertise also extends wide and beyond analysis, advising clients on identifying growth potential in established and niche market segments, investment/divestment decisions, and market entry decision-making.

Nikhil holds an MBA degree in Marketing and IT and a Graduate in Mechanical Engineering. Nikhil has authored several publications and quoted in journals like EMS Now, EPR Magazine, and EE Times.

Explore FMI’s Extensive Coverage in the Chemicals & Materials Domain:

The global green fertilizer industry value reached USD 2145.7 million in 2023. Over the forecast period, the value is anticipated to rise at 4.5% CAGR.

The global organic fertilizer market size is anticipated to reach USD 8,764.3 million in 2024. The industry is projected to attain a value of around USD 15,994.2 million in 2034.

According to the detailed report by Future Market Insights (FMI), the global phosphate fertilizer market recorded sales of USD 20,623.0 million in 2018. The market experienced a 30.0% year-on-year growth in 2022 and is anticipated to achieve revenues of USD 55,599.5 million in 2023.

The global bioenzyme fertilizer market value is likely to reach US$ 645 million in 2023. From 2023 to 2033, global sales are expected to soar at a robust CAGR of 8.9%.

The global sales of silicone are estimated to be worth USD 18,432.1 million in 2024 and are anticipated to reach a value of USD 29,456.9 million by 2034.

The global pyrolytic boron nitride (PBN) sales revenue totaled US$ 201.8 million in 2022 and is set to reach USD 211.4 million by 2023.

The polyether modified polysiloxane market size is projected to be worth USD 1,278.6 million in 2023. The market is likely to surpass US$ 2,122.7 million by 2033 at a CAGR of 5.2% during the forecast period.

The global demand for polycrystalline silicon market is projected to have a rapid-paced CAGR of 11.20% during the forecast period. The current valuation of the market is US$ 9.35 Billion in 2022.

The global magnetic materials market size is projected to cross a valuation of around USD 19,845.2 million in 2023. It is anticipated to register a CAGR of 7.3% in the forecast period from 2023 to 2033.

The bonded abrasives market size is set to register a standard CAGR of nearly 5% during the forecast period.

About Future Market Insights (FMI)

Future Market Insights (FMI) is a leading provider of market intelligence and consulting services, serving clients in over 150 countries. FMI is headquartered in Dubai and has delivery centers in the United Kingdom, the United States, and India. FMI’s latest market research reports and industry analysis helps businesses navigate challenges and make critical decisions with confidence and clarity amidst breakneck competition. Our customized and syndicated market research reports deliver actionable insights that drive sustainable growth. A team of expert-led analysts at FMI continuously tracks emerging trends and events in a broad range of industries to ensure that our clients prepare for the evolving needs of their consumers.
